intro: Lycoctonum quelpaertense, commonly known as the Jeju bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the island of Jeju in South Korea. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, white or pale blue flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal areas, adapting to the harsh environmental conditions of its habitat. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are often hairy and upright. Due to its limited distribution and unique appearance, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
